verses.verse: {The Lover} d I've come into my garden, my sister, my {The Heb. lacks my} bride; I've gathered my myrrh with my spices. I've eaten my honeycomb with my honey. I've drunk my wine with my milk. Eat, friends! Drink and become drunk with love.

{The Loved One} d I was asleep, but my heart was awake. There's a sound! My beloved is knocking. {The Lover} d"Open up for me, my sister, my darling, my dove, my perfect one. For my head is drenched with dew, my hair with the dampness of the night."

{The Loved One} d "I've taken off my clothes {Or my tunic} am I supposed to put them on again? {Lit. How shall I put them on again?} I've washed my feet am I supposed to {Lit. How shall I} get them dirty again?"
My beloved reached out his hand for the latch. {Or keyhole} My feelings for him were aroused.
I got up to open the door, {The Heb. lacks the door} and my hands dripped with myrrh, my fingers with liquid myrrh, on the handle of the lock.

I opened the door {The Heb. lacks the door} for my beloved, but my beloved had turned away; he was gone! My very life went out when he departed. {Or when he spoke} I searched for him, but couldn't find him. I called out to him, but he didn't answer.
The watchmen making their {The Heb. lacks their} rounds through the city found me. They beat me, they bruised me. Those guarding the walls took my cloak {Or shawl} from me.
I charge you, young women of Jerusalem, "If you find my beloved, what are you to tell him? Tell him {The Heb. lacks Tell him} that I'm weak with love."

{The Young Women} d What is so special about your beloved, {Or How is your beloved better than other beloveds} most beautiful of women? What is so special about your beloved, that you charge us like this?
{The Loved One} d My beloved is dazzling, with a dark and healthy complexion, outstanding among ten thousand.
His head is pure gold, his hair is wavy, black like a raven.
His eyes are like doves by streams of water, bathed in milk, mounted like jewels.
His cheeks are like beds of spices, like towers of perfume. His lips are lilies, dripping with liquid myrrh.
His hands are rods of gold, set with beryl. His stomach is carved ivory, inlaid with sapphires. {Or lapis lazuli}
His legs are pillars of marble set on bases of pure gold. His appearance is like Lebanon, choice like its cedars.
His mouth {Lit. palate} is sweetness, and all of him is desirable. This is my beloved, this is my friend, young women of Jerusalem!
